main event: On December 13, 1955, in Cincinnati, Ohio, an ellipsoid object with a blue-white exhaust of orange-reddish light was observed for about 60 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed at an estimated altitude of 12,000 ft and appeared radiant and translucent.
The report indicates that there was insufficient data for evaluation, leaving the sighting unexplained.
It was observed both visually and with a telescope for a total of 35 minutes.
The sighting was reported to Col. George D. Nelson, Director of Intelligence of HQCDC and Wright Field in Dayton, Ohio.
The report includes references to Part 2 and Part 3 objects, both with similar characteristics.
sighted object: ellipsoid object with blue-white exhaust of orange-reddish light
witnesses: Col. George D. Nelson, Director of Intelligence of HQCDC and Wright Field
